understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_metho: The unclear code is a method named getCDCSpaceInMB() which returns the value of conf.cdc_total_space_in_mb.
understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_code_: The unclear code is related to the configuration parameter cdc_total_space_in_mb, which represents the total space to use for change-data-capture logs on disk. The method getCDCSpaceInMB() retrieves this configuration value for further calculations in the code.

config_description: Total space to use for change-data-capture logs on disk.  If space gets above this value, Cassandra will throw WriteTimeoutException on Mutations including tables with CDC enabled. A CDCCompactor is responsible for parsing the raw CDC logs and deleting them when parsing is completed.  The default value is the min of 4096 mb and 1/8th of the total space of the drive where cdc_raw_directory resides.
developer_understanding_on_working: The configuration code 'cdc_total_space_in_mb' is used to determine the total space available for change-data-capture logs on disk. It calculates the total space by multiplying the value of 'DatabaseDescriptor.getCDCSpaceInMB()' by 1024 * 1024.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The triggering frequency of the 'cdc_total_space_in_mb' configuration is dependent on the usage of change-data-capture logs and the rate at which the logs are generated. If the space allocated for CDC logs exceeds the specified value, Cassandra will throw WriteTimeoutException on Mutations including tables with CDC enabled.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: The impact of the 'cdc_total_space_in_mb' configuration option on the system is significant. If the space allocated for CDC logs exceeds the specified value, it can lead to performance issues such as WriteTimeoutException on Mutations. It is crucial to monitor and adjust this configuration to ensure smooth operation of the system.
